fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In an opinion piece discussing the proposed law about dangerous cycling, we confused force and energy when we said “a 1,000kg car moving at 22mph will exert a force of 50kJ” (Cyclists are not the villains when it comes to road deaths, 9 March, page 4, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: Nerve gas in Salisbury, drones in Syria: is there a moral difference? Road to nowhere: the new crop of writers unearthing the dark side of village life Freezing Britain and the chill wind of austerity
